content.question:
Which of the following methods can be used to find the derivative of <math alttext="y equals, arcsine x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>arcsin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> with respect to <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?
Use the quotient rule to differentiate <math alttext="the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator sine x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>.
Use the chain rule to differentiate <math alttext="the sine of open parenthesis, arcsine x, close parenthesis, equals x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>arcsin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.
Use implicit differentiation to differentiate the function <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> in the relation <math alttext="sine y, equals x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> with respect to <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

unit.text: 3: Differentiation: Composite, Implicit, and Inverse Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
